summary: This document is an email chain from July 2023 discussing Leon Black's settlement with the US Virgin Islands over an Epstein probe and allegations of sexual assault. It involves internal DOJ communication and an external email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen urging investigation.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: External attorney who emails the DOJ to follow up on Leon Black, reporting his $62.5 million settlement with USVI and allegations he sexually assaulted multiple women.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Financial executive who paid $62.5 million to USVI in settlement over Epstein probe and is accused of sexual assault by multiple women.

connections.description: Christensen is urging investigation into Black regarding sexual assault allegations and his financial settlement with USVI over Epstein probe.

events.title: Reuters reports Leon Black settlement with USVI
events.description: Leon Black settles with US Virgin Islands for $62.5 million over Epstein probe, as reported by Reuters.

events.title: Jeanne Christensen emails DOJ about Leon Black
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen sends external email to DOJ urging investigation into Leon Black based on new settlement information and sexual assault allegations.

keyFacts: Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands in a settlement related to the Epstein probe.
Jeanne M. Christensen alleges Leon Black sexually assaulted multiple women, with one lawyer representing ten alleged victims.
The DOJ internal discussion indicates no evidence of overlap with Ghislaine Maxwell in Black's case based on current information.
The communication shows external legal pressure on the DOJ to investigate Leon Black criminally.
